title: Reuse of building materials—the perspective of Swedish clients

methodology.interviewees: Project managers at property companies with reuse experience

key_issues: Climate-conscious measures cost more than traditional construction
Allocating costs within organisations is complex
Time-consuming and less efficient than new materials
Reused materials often more expensive even when free

top_barriers.barrier: Absence of a professional reuse market
key_issues: Challenging to obtain large quantities of uniform products
Poor external supply vs internal supply
Storage challenges and lost rental income
Transitioning from old practices is challenging
Poor reuse inventories from external consultants

top_enablers.enabler: New and improved project management methods
Enhancing competence and learning within and beyond organisations
key_factors: Experience, courage, and starting where one stands
Contractors bringing reuse thinking to other projects

top_enablers.enabler: Introduce reuse at an early stage
key_factors: On-site inventory by designers prior to design
Clear reuse requirements facilitate quality assurance
Facility managers can assess internal reuse

top_enablers.enabler: Positive attitude and changing of norms
key_factors: Companies/municipalities required to lower climate impact
Explaining why they reuse increases acceptance
Surprising willingness to pay for disassembled material

obsolete_project_management.note: Public sector finds it harder to develop new management methods

positive_attitude_changing_norms.note: Private companies report better tenant acceptance

overregulation_barrier.note: Larger companies better equipped to navigate regulations

enabling_policies.note: Larger companies have more capacity for policy engagement

for_industry: Develop new project management methods adopting circular economy principles
Establish partnerships for shared reuse markets
for_policymakers: Increase transparency in pricing - simplify material cost comparisons
Develop manufacturer engagement and take-back systems
Clarify Planning and Building Act regarding reuse
Create practical guidance rather than prescriptive directives
Consider separate regulations for new construction vs renovation
for_researchers: Investigate client's role, possibilities and obligations
Develop effective material sourcing methods supported by digitalisation
Study economic aspects of reuse more comprehensively

contract_forms.recommended: Cost-plus contracts more beneficial than fixed-price for reuse projects

relevance_to_nordic_circular_buildings.norway_comparison: Similar barriers likely exist - validates Norwegian project experiences
relevance_to_nordic_circular_buildings.useful_metrics: Response rates by company size/type useful for analysis
